message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ‘N’ domains remain invariant in all individuals, which means they are highly conserved. Among the options, only the α3 domain in class I MHC molecules is non-polymorphic. The β2 domain in class II molecules, on the other hand, is highly polymorphic.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on major histocompatibility complex for help. Class I MHC molecules have three domains (α1, α2, and α3) while class II MHC molecules have two domains (α1-β1). The nonpolymorphic domains are the α3 domain in class I molecules and the β2 domain in class II molecules. Therefore, the correct answer is (D).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ‘P’ domains are found in the α1 and β1 domains of class I and class II MHC molecules, respectively, and are polymorphic, meaning they vary between individuals. The ‘N’ domains are non-polymorphic and include the α3 domain in class I molecules and the β2 domain in class II molecules. Therefore, option D is the correct answer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ‘N’ domains are the ones that remain invariant in all individuals. Among the options given, only the α3 domain in class I molecules and β2 domain in class II molecules are non-polymorphic and invariant in all individuals.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on major histocompatibility complex for help. Nonpolymorphic domains are those that remain invariant in all individuals. In class I MHC molecules, the α3 domain is nonpolymorphic, while in class II MHC molecules, the β2 domain is nonpolymorphic. Therefore, the correct answer is (D).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only answer choice (D) includes the α3 domain in class I MHC molecules and the β2 domain in class II MHC molecules as nonpolymorphic domains. The α1, α2, and β1 domains are polymorphic in both class I and class II MHC molecules.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question is asking for examples of ‘N’ (non-polymorphic) domains in class I and class II MHC molecules. Option D is correct as the α3 domain in class I molecules and the β2 domain in class II molecules are nonpolymorphic domains that remain invariant in all individuals. The other options have at least one polymorphic domain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The α3 domain in class I MHC molecules and the β2 domain in class II MHC molecules are both nonpolymorphic domains, meaning they remain invariant in all individuals. All other options contain at least one polymorphic domain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on major histocompatibility complex for help. The α3 domain in class I MHC molecules and β2 domain in class II MHC molecules are both nonpolymorphic and invariant in all individuals. The other options either include a polymorphic domain (P domain) or a combination of both polymorphic and nonpolymorphic domains.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on major histocompatibility complex for help. The α3 domain in class I MHC molecules and β2 domain in class II MHC molecules are both nonpolymorphic and invariant in all individuals. Option A is incorrect because the α1 domain in class I molecules and the α1 domain in class II molecules are both polymorphic. Option B is incorrect because the α2 domain in class I molecules is polymorphic and the β2 domain in class II molecules is nonpolymorphic. Option C is incorrect because both the α1-α2 domains in class I molecules and the α1-β1 domains in class II molecules are polymorphic.
